title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others‚Äô private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla‚Äôs code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to glystats
text: outlines propose change glystats. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to glystats
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ‚Äôll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to glystats
text: want make bigger change, ‚Äôs good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ‚Äôs needed. ‚Äôve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to glystats
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven‚Äôt done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("glycoverse/glystats", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn‚Äôt pass cleanly, ‚Äôs good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e.¬†just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to glystats
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don‚Äôt restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to glystats
text: Please note glystats project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: Statistical Analysis of Glycoproteomics and Glycomics Data

text: goal glystats perform statistical analysis glycoproteomics glycomics data. works seamlessly glyexp package.

title: Statistical Analysis of Glycoproteomics and Glycomics Data
text: can install development version glystats GitHub :

title: Statistical Analysis of Glycoproteomics and Glycomics Data
text: üìö Reference:

title: Statistical Analysis of Glycoproteomics and Glycomics Data
text: glystats downstream analysis package glycoverse ecosystem. provides statistical analysis functions glyexp::experiment() objects. common workflow use glyread import data, glyclean preprocess data, glystats perform statistical analysis.

title: Statistical Analysis of Glycoproteomics and Glycomics Data
text: Say already preprocessed experiment object called exp: ‚Äôs ! functions use glycoverse column conventions load needed data perform analysis. functions start gly_ leverage auto-completion RStudio. accept glyexp::experiment() object, return analysis result tibble list tibbles. See documentation function details.
code: # Two-sample t-test ttest_res <- gly_ttest(exp)  # PCA analysis pca_res <- gly_pca(exp)  # ROC analysis roc_res <- gly_roc(exp)

what: One-way ANOVA for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_anova
title: One-way ANOVA for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_anova
text: Perform one-way ANOVA glycomics glycoproteomics data. function supports parametric comparison multiple groups. significant results, Tukey's HSD post-hoc test automatically performed. P-values adjusted multiple testing using method specified p_adj_method.

title: One-way ANOVA for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_anova
code: gly_anova(   exp,   group_col = "group",   p_adj_method = "BH",   add_info = TRUE,   return_raw = FALSE,   ... )

title: One-way ANOVA for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_anova
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. group_col character string specifying column name grouping variable sample information. Default "group". p_adj_method character string specifying method adjust p-values. See p.adjust.methods available methods. Default "BH". NULL, adjustment performed. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), variable information experiment added result tibble. FALSE, statistical results returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw statistical model objects list. ... Additional arguments passed stats::aov().

title: One-way ANOVA for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_anova
text: tibble ANOVA results post_hoc column indicating significant group pairs, list aov models TukeyHSD objects return_raw TRUE.

title: One-way ANOVA for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_anova
text: function performs log2 transformation expression data (log2(x + 1)) statistical testing. least 2 groups required grouping variable. Post-hoc Test: Tukey's HSD test pairwise comparisons (stats::TukeyHSD()) performed variables significant main effects (p_adj < 0.05).

what: Correlation Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_cor
title: Correlation Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_cor
text: Perform pairwise correlation analysis variables samples expression data. function calculates correlation coefficients p-values pairs, optional multiple testing correction.

title: Correlation Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_cor
code: gly_cor(   exp,   on = "variable",   method = "pearson",   p_adj_method = "BH",   return_raw = FALSE,   ... )

title: Correlation Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_cor
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. character string specifying correlate. Either "variable" (default) correlate variables/features, "sample" correlate samples/observations. method character string indicating correlation coefficient computed. One "pearson" (default) "spearman". Note: "kendall" supported Hmisc::rcorr. p_adj_method character string specifying method adjust p-values. See p.adjust.methods available methods. Default "BH". NULL, adjustment performed. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw rcorr object. ... Additional arguments passed Hmisc::rcorr().

title: Correlation Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_cor
text: tibble correlation results (return_raw = FALSE): First column: First element pair (variable1/sample1) Second column: Second element pair (variable2/sample2) cor: Correlation coefficient p_value: Raw p-value p_adj: Adjusted p-value (p_adj_method NULL) return_raw = TRUE, returns raw rcorr object.

title: Correlation Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_cor
text: function performs log2 transformation expression data (log2(x + 1)) correlation analysis. = "variable" (default), correlations calculated variables across samples. = "sample", correlations calculated samples across variables. Correlation Calculation: Correlation coefficients p-values calculated using Hmisc::rcorr() efficient pairwise stats::cor.test() calls. Multiple Testing Correction: P-values adjusted multiple testing using method specified p_adj_method.

title: Correlation Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_cor
text: function requires Hmisc package efficient correlation calculation.

what: GO, KEGG, and Reactome over-representation analysis (ORA) ‚Äî gly_enrich_go
title: GO, KEGG, and Reactome over-representation analysis (ORA) ‚Äî gly_enrich_go
text: Perform GO, KEGG, Reactome ORA proteins (genes) glyexp::experiment(). function uses "protein" column variable information tibble. Protein identifiers UniProt accessions.

title: GO, KEGG, and Reactome over-representation analysis (ORA) ‚Äî gly_enrich_go
code: gly_enrich_go(exp, add_info = TRUE, return_raw = FALSE, ...)  gly_enrich_kegg(exp, add_info = TRUE, return_raw = FALSE, ...)  gly_enrich_reactome(exp, add_info = TRUE, return_raw = FALSE, ...)

title: GO, KEGG, and Reactome over-representation analysis (ORA) ‚Äî gly_enrich_go
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object. add_info logical value. parameter included API consistency effect since enrichment results contain variable sample columns. return_raw logical value indicating whether return raw clusterProfiler enrichResult objects. ... Additional arguments passed clusterProfiler::enrichGO(), clusterProfiler::enrichKEGG(), ReactomePA::enrichPathway().

title: GO, KEGG, and Reactome over-representation analysis (ORA) ‚Äî gly_enrich_go
text: tibble GO, KEGG, Reactome enrichment results (return_raw = FALSE), raw clusterProfiler enrichResult objects (return_raw = TRUE).

title: GO, KEGG, and Reactome over-representation analysis (ORA) ‚Äî gly_enrich_go
text: function requires following packages installed: clusterProfiler enrichment analysis ReactomePA Reactome pathway analysis org.Hs.eg.db human gene annotation (GO analysis )

title: Calculate fold change ‚Äî gly_fold_change
text: Calculate fold change given expression matrix group information. used 2-group analysis. run function, see message "Group 1" "Group 2". "Group 1" reference group, "Group 2" test group.

title: Calculate fold change ‚Äî gly_fold_change
Calculate fold change ‚Äî gly_fold_change
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object. group_col column name group information sample information. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), variable information experiment added result tibble. FALSE, fold change results returned.

title: Calculate fold change ‚Äî gly_fold_change
text: tibble two columns: variable log2fc.

what: Hierarchical Clustering for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_hclust
title: Hierarchical Clustering for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_hclust
text: Perform hierarchical clustering expression data. function uses stats::hclust() perform clustering provides tidy results including cluster assignments, dendrogram data plotting, merge heights.

title: Hierarchical Clustering for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_hclust
code: gly_hclust(   exp,   on = "variable",   method = "complete",   dist_method = "euclidean",   k_values = c(2, 3, 4, 5),   scale = TRUE,   add_info = TRUE,   return_raw = FALSE,   ... )

title: Hierarchical Clustering for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_hclust
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. character string specifying cluster. Either "variable" (default) cluster variables/features, "sample" cluster samples/observations. method agglomeration method used. one "ward.D", "ward.D2", "single", "complete", "average", "mcquitty", "median", "centroid". Default "complete". dist_method distance measure used. must one "euclidean", "maximum", "manhattan", "canberra", "binary", "minkowski". Default "euclidean". k_values numeric vector specifying number clusters cut tree . Default c(2, 3, 4, 5). NULL, cluster assignments returned. scale logical indicating whether scale data clustering. Default TRUE. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), sample information experiment added result tibbles. FALSE, clustering results returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw hclust object. ... Additional arguments passed stats::dist() stats::hclust().

title: Hierarchical Clustering for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_hclust
text: list containing multiple tibbles (return_raw = FALSE): clusters: Cluster assignments different k values (variables samples depending parameter) dendrogram: Dendrogram segment data plotting (ggdendro available) heights: Merge heights steps clustering process labels: Labels positions (ggdendro available) return_raw = TRUE, returns raw hclust object.

title: Hierarchical Clustering for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_hclust
text: function performs log2 transformation expression data (log2(x + 1)) clustering. = "variable" (default), variables clustered based expression patterns across samples. = "sample", samples clustered based expression profiles across variables. Distance Calculation: Distance calculated using stats::dist() specified method. Clustering Method: Hierarchical clustering performed using stats::hclust() specified method. Cluster Assignment: dendrogram cut different heights produce cluster assignments specified k values using stats::cutree().

title: Hierarchical Clustering for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_hclust
text: function uses base R packages require additional dependencies. enhanced dendrogram plotting capabilities, ggdendro package recommended required.

what: Kruskal-Wallis test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_kruskal
title: Kruskal-Wallis test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_kruskal
text: Perform Kruskal-Wallis test glycomics glycoproteomics data. function supports non-parametric comparison multiple groups. significant results, Dunn's post-hoc test automatically performed. P-values adjusted multiple testing using method specified p_adj_method.

title: Kruskal-Wallis test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_kruskal
code: gly_kruskal(   exp,   group_col = "group",   p_adj_method = "BH",   add_info = TRUE,   return_raw = FALSE,   ... )

title: Kruskal-Wallis test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_kruskal
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. group_col character string specifying column name grouping variable sample information. Default "group". p_adj_method character string specifying method adjust p-values. See p.adjust.methods available methods. Default "BH". NULL, adjustment performed. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), variable information experiment added result tibble. FALSE, statistical results returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw statistical model objects list. ... Additional arguments passed stats::kruskal.test().

title: Kruskal-Wallis test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_kruskal
text: tibble Kruskal-Wallis test results post_hoc column indicating significant group pairs, list kruskal.test objects dunnTest objects return_raw TRUE.

title: Kruskal-Wallis test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_kruskal
text: function performs log2 transformation expression data (log2(x + 1)) statistical testing. least 2 groups required grouping variable. Post-hoc Test: Dunn's test Holm correction multiple comparisons (FSA::dunnTest()) performed variables significant main effects (p_adj < 0.05).

title: Kruskal-Wallis test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_kruskal
text: function requires FSA package Dunn's post-hoc test.

what: Orthogonal Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (OPLS-DA) ‚Äî gly_oplsda
title: Orthogonal Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (OPLS-DA) ‚Äî gly_oplsda
text: Perform orthogonal partial least squares discriminant analysis expression data. function uses ropls::opls() perform OPLS-DA returns tidy results.

title: Orthogonal Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (OPLS-DA) ‚Äî gly_oplsda
code: gly_oplsda(   exp,   group_col = "group",   pred_i = 1,   ortho_i = NA,   scale = TRUE,   add_info = TRUE,   return_raw = FALSE,   ... )

title: Orthogonal Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (OPLS-DA) ‚Äî gly_oplsda
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. group_col character string specifying column name sample information contains group labels. Default "group". pred_i integer indicating number predictive components include. Default 1. ortho_i integer indicating number orthogonal components include. Default NA (automatic). scale logical indicating whether scale data. Default TRUE. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), sample variable information experiment added result tibbles. FALSE, OPLS-DA results returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw ropls opls object. ... Additional arguments passed ropls::opls().

title: Orthogonal Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (OPLS-DA) ‚Äî gly_oplsda
text: list containing four tibbles (return_raw = FALSE): samples: OPLS-DA scores sample group information variables: OPLS-DA loadings variable variance: OPLS-DA explained variance information vip: Variable Importance Projection (VIP) scores variable return_raw = TRUE, returns raw ropls opls object.

title: Orthogonal Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (OPLS-DA) ‚Äî gly_oplsda
text: function requires following packages installed: ropls OPLS-DA analysis

title: Orthogonal Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (OPLS-DA) ‚Äî gly_oplsda
text: According Topliss ratio principle, ratio samples variables (n/p) least 5 avoid overfitting ensure reliable results. function throw error n/p < 5. datasets high dimensionality relative sample size, consider: Feature selection analysis Collecting samples

Default TRUE. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), sample variable information experiment added result tibbles. FALSE, PCA results returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw prcomp object. ... Additional arguments passed prcomp().

title: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) ‚Äî gly_pca
text: list containing three tibbles (return_raw = FALSE): samples: PCA scores sample variables: PCA loadings variable eigenvalues: PCA eigenvalues return_raw = TRUE, returns raw prcomp object.

what: ROC Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_roc
title: ROC Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_roc
text: Perform Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) analysis binary classification glycomics glycoproteomics data. function calculates ROC curves Area Curve (AUC) values variable assess discriminatory power two groups.

title: ROC Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_roc
code: gly_roc(   exp,   group_col = "group",   pos_class = NULL,   add_info = TRUE,   return_raw = FALSE )

title: ROC Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_roc
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. group_col character string specifying column name grouping variable sample information. Default "group". grouping variable must exactly 2 levels binary classification. pos_class character string specifying group level treated positive class. NULL (default), second level (alphabetically) used positive class. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), variable information experiment added result tibbles. FALSE, ROC analysis results returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed results AUC values threshold coordinates. TRUE, returns raw pROC objects list.

title: ROC Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_roc
text: list containing two elements: auc: tibble containing AUC values variable, columns: variable: Variable name auc: AUC value coords: tibble containing ROC curve coordinates columns: variable: Variable name threshold: Threshold value sensitivity: Sensitivity (True Positive Rate) specificity: Specificity (True Negative Rate) return_raw TRUE, returns list pROC objects.

title: ROC Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_roc
text: variable, ROC curve computed using expression values predictor binary group labels response. function requires exactly 2 groups specified grouping variable. 2 groups present, error thrown. Underlying Function: ROC analysis performed using pROC::roc() Coordinates extracted using pROC::coords()

title: ROC Analysis for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics Data ‚Äî gly_roc
text: function requires pROC package installed ROC curve computation.

title: t-Distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE) ‚Äî gly_tsne
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. dims Number output dimensions. Default 2. perplexity Perplexity parameter t-SNE. Default 30. theta Speed/accuracy trade-parameter. Default 0.5. max_iter Maximum number iterations. Default 1000. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), sample information experiment added result tibble. FALSE, t-SNE coordinates returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw Rtsne object. ... Additional arguments passed Rtsne::Rtsne().

title: t-Distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE) ‚Äî gly_tsne
text: tibble t-SNE coordinates (tsne1, tsne2) return_raw = FALSE, raw Rtsne object return_raw = TRUE.

title: t-Distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE) ‚Äî gly_tsne

text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. group_col character string specifying column name grouping variable sample information. Default "group". p_adj_method character string specifying method adjust p-values. See p.adjust.methods available methods. Default "BH". NULL, adjustment performed. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), variable information experiment added result tibble. FALSE, statistical results returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw statistical model objects list. ... Additional arguments passed stats::t.test().

text: Perform UMAP dimensionality reduction expression data. function uses uwot::umap() perform UMAP analysis.

title: Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) ‚Äî gly_umap
code: gly_umap(   exp,   n_neighbors = 15,   n_components = 2,   min_dist = 0.1,   spread = 1,   metric = "euclidean",   n_epochs = 200,   learning_rate = 1,   add_info = TRUE,   return_raw = FALSE,   ... )

title: Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) ‚Äî gly_umap
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. n_neighbors Number neighbors consider point. Default 15. n_components Number output dimensions. Default 2. min_dist Minimum distance embedded points. Default 0.1. spread Controls tightly embedding packed. Default 1.0. metric Distance metric use. Default "euclidean". n_epochs Number training epochs. Default 200. learning_rate Learning rate optimization. Default 1.0. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), sample information experiment added result tibble. FALSE, UMAP coordinates returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw umap result matrix. ... Additional arguments passed uwot::umap().

title: Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) ‚Äî gly_umap
text: tibble UMAP coordinates (umap1, umap2) return_raw = FALSE, raw umap result matrix return_raw = TRUE.

title: Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) ‚Äî gly_umap
text: function requires uwot package installed UMAP analysis.

what: Wilcoxon rank-sum test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_wilcox
title: Wilcoxon rank-sum test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_wilcox
text: Perform Wilcoxon rank-sum test (Mann-Whitney U test) glycomics glycoproteomics data. function supports non-parametric comparison two groups. P-values adjusted multiple testing using method specified p_adj_method.

title: Wilcoxon rank-sum test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_wilcox
code: gly_wilcox(   exp,   group_col = "group",   p_adj_method = "BH",   add_info = TRUE,   return_raw = FALSE,   ... )

title: Wilcoxon rank-sum test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_wilcox
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object containing expression matrix sample information. group_col character string specifying column name grouping variable sample information. Default "group". p_adj_method character string specifying method adjust p-values. See p.adjust.methods available methods. Default "BH". NULL, adjustment performed. add_info logical value. TRUE (default), variable information experiment added result tibble. FALSE, statistical results returned. return_raw logical value. FALSE (default), returns processed tibble results. TRUE, returns raw statistical model objects list. ... Additional arguments passed stats::wilcox.test().

title: Wilcoxon rank-sum test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_wilcox
text: tibble Wilcoxon test results including log2 fold change (log2fc), list wilcox.test models return_raw TRUE.

title: Wilcoxon rank-sum test for Differential Expression Analysis ‚Äî gly_wilcox
text: function performs log2 transformation expression data (log2(x + 1)) statistical testing. Exactly 2 groups required grouping variable.

what: glystats: Statistical Analysis of Glycoproteomics and Glycomics Data ‚Äî glystats-package
title: glystats: Statistical Analysis of Glycoproteomics and Glycomics Data ‚Äî glystats-package
text: package provides statistical analysis glycoproteomics glycomics data. works seamlessly 'glyexp' package.
